pageContext.claim: “Farmers are starting to do great again, after 15 years of a downward spiral. The 16 Billion Dollar China 'replacement' money didn’t exactly hurt!”
pageContext.analysis: National net farm income, a key indicator of how well farmers are doing, has been declining since 2013 — meaning five, not 15, years. “U.S. farm income experienced a golden period during 2011 through 2014 due to strong commodity prices and robust agricultural exports,” according to the nonpartisan Congressional Research Service. Trump's trade wars have further hurt farmers, despite $28 billion in bailouts, and so bankruptcies are soaring.
